subject: Design
title: Emotion-Sensing Interfaces: Computers That Read Your Mood
description: Learn Emotion-Sensing Interfaces: Computers That Read Your Mood in one minute.

hook.text: Your smartwatch knows your heart rate. Future interfaces will read your emotions and adapt in real time.

buildup.text: Affective computing uses facial recognition, voice tone, and biometrics to detect user emotional states.

discovery.text: Spotify experiments with mood-based playlists. Cars dim lights when drivers show stress signals.

twist.text: If software knows you're sad, should it sell you comfort food? Emotional data is ripe for manipulation.

climax.text: Emotion-sensing interfaces could be deeply empathetic or deeply invasive. Design intent decides.

punchline.text: The next interface won't ask what you want. It'll sense how you feel.

quiz.question: What ethical risk do emotion-sensing interfaces pose?
options: Emotional data could be used to manipulate users
